org.apache.juneau.rest.mock

Class MockRest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.rest.mock.MockRest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MockHttpConnection
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public class MockRest
extends Object
implements MockHttpConnection
    Creates a mocked interface against a REST resource class.
    Deprecated - Use org.apache.juneau.restmock2

    Allows you to test your REST resource classes without a running servlet container.

    Example:

    public class MockTest { // Our REST resource to test. @Rest(serializers=JsonSerializer.Simple.class, parsers=JsonParser.class) public static class MyRest { @RestMethod(name=PUT, path="/String") public String echo(@Body String b) { return b; } } @Test public void testEcho() throws Exception { MockRest .create(MyRest.class) .put("/String", "'foo'") .execute() .assertStatus(200) .assertBody("'foo'"); }

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static MockRest create(Class<?> c)
                       throws RuntimeException
        Deprecated. 
        Create a new mock REST interface
        Parameters:
        c - The REST class.
        Returns:
        A new mock interface.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - For testing conveniences, this method wraps all exceptions in a RuntimeException so that you can easily define mocks as reusable fields.

      • create

        public static MockRest create(Class<?> c,
                              boolean debug)
                       throws RuntimeException
        Deprecated. 
        Create a new mock REST interface
        Parameters:
        c - The REST class.
        debug - If true, the REST interface will use the BasicRestLogger for logging.
        Otherwise, uses NoOpRestLogger.
        Returns:
        A new mock interface.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - For testing conveniences, this method wraps all exceptions in a RuntimeException so that you can easily define mocks as reusable fields.
